page.title: 11FARMING, DOWNS EDINGTON (3)
page.content: The farmer is semi-retired.Two sons manage the crops and the livestock respectively,and there are three employees.Some advice regarding the spray programme is sought from a consultant salesman.The farm is one of a group of corn growers and a merchant,who meet and exchange information.Hereford cross Friesian calves are bought in and bucket fed on low acid milk,first in individual pens,then in batches.There are 200 head of cattle jointlu run on West Down Farm and Ballards Farm.In winter 60 to 100 are fed clamp silage in yards and in the seven acre paddock at West Down Farm.In summer 100 cattle run on 130 acres,mostly in the vale.They are sold off fat from eighteen months of age.
